pullRequest.body:
leanprover/lean4#6024 fixes a serious elaboration bug which, perversely, was quite helpful.

Kyle is investigating replacing the bug with something intentional, but we definitively need to fix the bug in the meantime.

This is the backport of changes from lean-pr-testing-6024 which do not have conflicts with `master`. There are a few more changes that we'll need to handle separately later.

:v: kim-em can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

This is all fine. Re the new adaptation notes: I don't really understand enough about why they are there to comment, but I was surprised that they just all mentioned a date 11-11-2024 rather than the Lean issue https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/pull/6024 which was the cause of the adaptation. 

I also note that the Lean PR is not yet merged. I'm just flagging this because I don't really understand the workflow.
